page.title: 20BISLEY'S PAST REPUTATION
page.content: Now largely a dormitory village for the surrounding towns, Bisley was once the centre of a much larger parish (including Chalford and Oakridge until the late 19th century), most of whose inhabitants were engaged in woollen -cloth manufacture. In 1831 the population was nearly 6,000 making Bisley one of the largest parishes in the county, but by then Glos'shire cloth trade had gone into a sharp decline and Bisley especially was suffering massive unemployment with the bulk of the population having to be relieved by the Parish Poor Law authorities and the village workhouse always full of paupers. From this time comes the catch "Mincing Hampton, Painswick Proud, Beggarly Bisley and Strutting Stroud." And the response to "Where are you from?" "From Bisley, God help us! "
